column4: Hello all - I have an Mplayer codec question. How do I configure Mplayer so that it will usually succeed in playing video files, whether they are mpeg, mov, avi, etc.? I assume it needs the Windows codecs; where are they found?
you need to see the restricted codecs section of the wiki

Sierra and nolimitsoya - looks like the pages you pointed me to will help. Do you know whether Mplayer uses the same backend as Totem (e.g., gstreamer and/or xine)? I'm more or less leaning toward Mplayer rather than Totem

I tried VLC and rejected it, but I don't remember why. (I *think* b/c it wouldn't play some vid format I needed.) Mplayer does *most* of what I want, but I am having trouble with some video formats, and I am guessing it's probably a codec issue.
what are you trying to play?
nothing too tricky. It gives me weird output (kaleidoscope colors, no sound) on some .wmv files and some .mov files
im dealing with someone elses problem Bjorne
right -- with wmv -- you need the w32codecs .deb installed
look at the link you were sent earliar
